intro: Ecbolium chapadense, commonly known as the Brazilian burr vine, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ecbolium chapadense is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
